answers.answer: Hi,It would be best to see a doctor to discuss all your symptoms. You made a mention of “thought I was having a heart attack” and this may or may not be related (could there be some psychological dimension to your problem?) .Gynecomastia may indeed be related with obesity. Erectile function is largely dependent on blood vessels (hence problems such as diabetes which damages blood vessels may make erectile function less, cholesterol may also be contributory as well as smoking).If there is usually an erection early in the morning, then this means that the blood vessels are intact. Chances are, there are hormonal imbalances (this again may be a function of obesity). That you have normal hormonal tests is a good thing. Tests however, may not be able to detect fluctuations as hormones are generally pulsatile not sustained over a period of time. Fluctuations in hormone levels may be responsible for the pattern of having erectile dysfunction (even sleep deprivation, or shifting work schedules may alter hormones).The simplest course of action may be to continue weight reduction, adequate exercise and adequate sleep, keep yourself smoke free, and try not to become frustrated if an episode of dysfunction arises.
